=== IRC Channel ===
The Ubuntu-tn community is currently utilizing the <nowiki>[[http://www.freenode.net|Freenode]]</nowiki> servers for IRC. If you are going to join a session, the channel to use is #ubuntu-tn-classroom. If it is your first time using IRC, we ask that you simply review the <nowiki>[[IrcGuidelines|IRC Guidelines]]</nowiki>. You may also be interested in this list of <nowiki>[[Classroom-IRCHOWTO| IRC HOWTO]]</nowiki> Pages.  To connect to the IRC server, use the following information: 
* '''Server:''' ''irc.ubuntu.com''
* '''Port:''' ''8001''
Once connected to the server type <code>/j #ubuntu-tn-classroom</code> to join the classroom channel. <code>#ubuntu-tn-classroom</code> isn't the main support channels, so you can't expect to join it searching for answers, as most of the time it is a ghost towns. We recommend you continue using <code>#ubuntu-tn</code>, <code>#ubuntu</code>, <code>#kubuntu</code>, <code>#edubuntu</code>,or <code>#xubuntu</code>.

=== Information ===

The classes will start promptly at the designated times. The classroom will be open briefly in order to provide the members and students the opportunity for brief introductions and instructions. Once the class begins, the channel may become moderated (+m), meaning only instructors and administrators will have speaking privileges. This will insure there are no interruptions, making the class enjoyable for everyone attending. If you have a question, there will be a moderator that will take your questions via a message. You can message the moderator by typing <code>/msg nickname question</code>. Further instructions will be given at the beginning of each class.

See the <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Classroom/Guidelines|Ubuntu Classroom Guidelines]]</nowiki> for more details.

=== Volunteer ===

The Classroom project is always looking for volunteers. We need help in the following areas:

*** Instruction: Develop courses from own resources
*** Instruction: Make use of Ubuntu-Training materials

*** Course Organization: Recruit Instructors
*** Course Organization: Recruit Teams for regular sessions
     
*** Course Organization: Schedule classes
*** Course Organization: Send reminders to Instructors
*** Course Organization/Marketing: Maintain wiki page

*** Marketing: Keep blogs, UWN & Fridge informed
  

Check out <nowiki>[[Classroom-Volunteer| our Volunteer page]]</nowiki> to add yourself to one of these tasks, or drop a note to the <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/mailman/listinfo/Ubuntu-classroom|Ubuntu-classroom Mailing List]]</nowiki> with your interest.

=== Contact ===
If you are interested in becoming a member or instructor or interested in seeing a specific class, have remarks on a past class, issues with what was taught, please post to the <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/mailman/listinfo/Ubuntu-classroom|Ubuntu-classroom Mailing List]]</nowiki> and the <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/mailman/listinfo/ubuntu-tn|Tuinsian mailing list too]]</nowiki> or check out the <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~ubuntu-classroom|Ubuntu Classroom Management]]</nowiki> page for people to contact directly.
